intro: Chuquiraga argentea, commonly known as silverleaf chuchuma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Chuquiraga argentea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some regions.
